name: Mayan Mythology
tagline: The Hero Twins and Cosmic Cycles
description: Journey through Mayan myths of creation, the Hero Twins' underworld quest, and astronomical precision.
overview: Mayan mythology features sophisticated cosmology linking astronomy, mathematics, and theology. The Popol Vuh creation epic describes multiple failed humanities before maize people. The Hero Twins Hunahpu and Xbalanque defeated the lords of Xibalba (underworld) and became sun and moon. Mayan religion emphasized: complex calendar systems (Tzolk'in, Haab), bloodletting rituals for communication with gods, ballgames as cosmic drama, astronomy and mathematics, cyclical time, and world trees connecting realms. The tradition continues among living Maya communities.

sections.title: Popol Vuh Creation
sections.body:
The gods attempted to create humans multiple times:
1. **Mud people** - dissolved in water
2. **Wood people** - had no hearts/minds, destroyed by flood
3. **Maize people** (current) - formed from corn dough, capable of praising gods

The Hero Twins' father and uncle were killed by Xibalba lords. The twins avenged them through trickery and skill, becoming celestial bodies.
